title: Harmonic Breach: Delve Protocol
tagline: When reality glitches, Heroes debug the world
summary: Modern Earth where video game popularity has reached critical mass, creating 'Imprints' - resonance patterns that eventually manifest as physical 'Delves' where game logic overwrites reality. These pocket dimensions threaten to expand and corrupt baseline reality permanently unless specialized Heroes can enter them and restore harmonic balance. Each Delve reflects the genre and mechanics of whatever games created the original Imprint, leading to bizarre fusion spaces where fantasy dungeons might contain cyberpunk security systems, or horror mansions might have platformer physics.
goals: Penetrate the Delve's layers of corrupted game logic, locate the reality Anchor at its core, and perform the Silencing ritual to collapse the pocket dimension back into normal space-time before it reaches Stage 5 resonance and begins permanently overwriting baseline reality.
victory_conditions: Heroes win collectively by successfully completing enough Challenge thresholds to reduce the Delve's Resonance to zero, representing the successful disruption of the harmful frequency pattern. Individual victory is impossible - either the entire team succeeds in restoring harmonic balance, or they all fail as reality becomes permanently corrupted by the runaway Imprint.

issues.title: Drive Generation Imbalance
issues.recommendation: Normalize total Drive generation across all Avatars to 6 tokens, adjusting distribution ratios instead of totals

issues.title: Resonance Death Spiral
issues.recommendation: Cap Resonance scaling at +2 maximum, or provide catch-up mechanics when teams fall behind

issues.title: Perfect Counter Trivializes Design
issues.recommendation: Limit Perfect Counter cards to 1-2 per deck, or require specific conditions to activate

issues.title: Extreme Player Count Modifiers
issues.recommendation: Reduce 6-player threshold increase from +6 to +3-4, add compensatory mechanics

issues.title: Combo Dependency Risk
issues.recommendation: Ensure base cards provide viable strategies without requiring specific combinations

issues.title: Information Advantage Disparity
issues.recommendation: Limit Quantum Mystic's peek ability to once per round or add cost

balance.overall_rating: The game has a solid cooperative framework but suffers from significant balance issues that could create frustrating play experiences. The Drive economy imbalances and scaling problems are particularly concerning as they could lead to certain Avatars being must-picks or early failures snowballing into inevitable defeat. The Perfect Counter mechanic undermines the core tag-matching system. However, the underlying design shows promise with good role differentiation and meaningful tactical choices.

turn_structure.phase_flow: Resonance → Challenge → Resolution → Refresh, repeating until Delve is Silenced or reaches critical Resonance
turn_structure.sample_turn: The team enters Round 3 of the 'Abandoned Arcade Horror Delve' with Resonance at Level 2. **Resonance Phase**: The GM reveals 'Possessed Cabinet Cluster' from the Delve Deck - a Challenge requiring 12 [Technology] and 6 [Combat] to overcome. The Scout uses her persistent ability to peek at the next Delve card, revealing even worse challenges ahead. **Challenge Phase**: The team coordinates their approach. The Technomancer plays 'Viral Mythology Spreader' (3 [Technology], 1 [Logic]) for 2 Mind Drive, announcing it will boost other tech cards. The Warrior contributes 'Quantum Norse Hammer' (4 [Combat], 2 [Technology]) for 2 Body + 1 Mind Drive, hoping someone else has Norse/Quantum synergy. The Scout adds 'Cybernetic Reflexes' (3 [Agility], 1 [Technology]) for 1 Body Drive, and the Mystic plays 'Hacked Runes' (2 [Logic], 3 [Technology]) for 1 Mind + 1 Agility Drive. **Resolution Phase**: Cards are revealed simultaneously! The Viral Spreader boosts all other tech cards' secondary Tags by +1, so the team's total becomes: 3+2+1+3=9 [Technology] plus bonuses, and 4 [Combat]. The +1 bonus from Viral Spreader pushes their [Technology] total to 10, but they're still 2 short of the 12 needed and 2 short on [Combat]. The challenge fails! Resonance increases to Level 3, and each Hero must discard one card. **Refresh Phase**: Heroes restore Drive (Technomancer gains 1 Body, 3 Mind, 2 Agility), draw back to hand limit, and prepare for an even more dangerous Round 4 with higher escalation rates. The team realizes they need better coordination and perhaps some Exhaust cards to handle the increasing difficulty.
turn_structure.actions_per_turn: Players contribute cards cooperatively during Challenge Phase, spending Drive tokens to activate card abilities and meet tag thresholds

setup: Each Hero selects an Avatar card and builds a 30-card Action deck from their Avatar's pool. Set up individual tableau areas with 3 slots per Hero (5 slots for campaign veterans). Create shared Drive pool with tokens equal to total Avatar generation values. GM selects 1 POI card and 1-2 Theme cards, then builds a Delve deck using standard point budget. Heroes draw opening hands and may play up to 2 cards to their starting tableau for free.
agency_justification: Players have complete control over which cards to play, how much Drive to spend, and how to coordinate contributions. Success depends on tactical card selection and team coordination, not random dice rolls.
theme_integration: The tableau system represents each Hero's current 'runtime configuration' - the specific combination of abilities and tools they have prepared for the immediate situation. Just as debugging software requires having the right tools loaded and ready, Heroes must thoughtfully configure their personal capabilities while coordinating with teammates who have different specializations. The shared Drive pool represents the team's collective focus and energy, requiring consensus on how to allocate their limited attention across different specialized approaches to the reality corruption.

scoring_formulas.formula: Team victory if Resonance reaches 0 through successful Challenges. Team defeat if Resonance reaches 5.
scoring_formulas.example: Heroes face 8 Challenges requiring 15 total successes to reduce Resonance from 4 to 0. Failing 3+ Challenges pushes Resonance to 5 = defeat.
scoring_formulas.max_potential: Binary: Complete Success or Total Failure

scoring_formulas.formula: Individual contribution tracked by cards played and Drive spent per Challenge
scoring_formulas.example: In Challenge requiring 12 [Combat]: Warrior contributes 8 [Combat] for 3 Body Drive, Scout adds 4 [Combat] for 2 Agility Drive

scoring_formulas.example: Team earns 3 Clue tokens from successful [Perception] Challenges. Spend 2 Clues to look at next 3 Delve cards.

mechanism_synergies: Tableau building creates individual agency while shared Drive ensures cooperative decision-making - players can prepare their own capabilities but must negotiate resource allocation
The three Drive types interact with tableau specialization to create meaningful role diversity - tech specialists build technology-focused tableaus while combat Heroes focus on Body-powered abilities

Avatar abilities and tableau management create emergent specialization - the Mystic's preview ability helps inform team tableau planning while the Scout's Drive conversion supports flexible resource allocation
Campaign progression and tableau expansion create long-term character development while maintaining session-to-session tactical flexibility
Open information eliminates alpha player control while preserving individual tactical decision-making about tableau composition and activation timing

balance_parameters.drive_generation_per_refresh: 6 tokens total per Avatar, distributed across Body/Mind/Agility types for specialization
balance_parameters.average_challenge_threshold: 8-15 total Tags required, scaling with Delve Resonance level
balance_parameters.card_activation_costs: 1-3 Drive per card, with powerful effects costing 2+ and cross-type cards requiring mixed Drive
balance_parameters.hand_size_limits: 5-7 cards depending on Avatar type, with Mystic at 7, Scout at 6, others at 5
balance_parameters.delve_escalation_rate: Individual Delve cards specify their Resonance-triggered effects. Common patterns: Resonance 2+ adds additional required tags, Resonance 3+ downgrades Success to Low Fail, Resonance 4+ downgrades Strong Success to Success, Resonance 5 often triggers automatic High Fail or special defeat conditions
balance_parameters.combo_bonus_threshold: 2+ matching genre/tag cards = +1 to primary Tag, 3+ cards = +2 bonus
balance_parameters.resonance_reduction_per_success: 1 point for standard Challenges, 2 points for Boss-type Challenges
balance_parameters.failure_escalation: +1 Resonance per failed Challenge, additional penalties vary by Challenge type
balance_parameters.clue_token_economy: 1 Clue per successful [Perception] Challenge, spend 2 Clues to preview 3 Delve cards or gain 2 Drive of any type
balance_parameters.challenge_threshold: Challenges require 1-4 specific tags to be matched by committed Hero cards. Tier outcomes: Strong Success (all tags matched or Perfect Counter used), Success (75%+ tags matched), Low Fail (25-74% tags matched), High Fail (0-24% tags matched). Resonance levels modify tag requirements and tier thresholds.
balance_parameters.delve_point_budget: 3 players = 50-60 points, 4 players = 65-75 points for standard Delve Deck construction. Player Count Modifier cards adjust these baselines for variant play.

sample_turn_detailed: The team enters Round 3 with Resonance at Level 2. **Resonance Phase**: 'Glitched Corridor' appears requiring [Perception] tag. Since Resonance is 2, it also requires [Technology] as secondary tag. **Challenge Phase**: Team coordinates commitment. Scout commits 'Cybernetic Reflexes' ([Agility], [Perception]) covering [Perception]. Technomancer commits 'System Interface' ([Technology], [Logic]) covering [Technology]. Warrior spends 1 Body Drive to activate tableau ability for next round setup. **Resolution**: Both required tags covered = Strong Success. Team gains 2 Clue tokens and previews next Delve card, which helps plan tableau modifications during **Refresh Phase**.
